entities.name: lupin
entities.description: Lupin is mentioned as a character in the conversation. He is described as having a smile that is 'a little too understanding'. (comment of no real importance, but he was not sure he had achieved the right effect; Lupin’s smile was a little too understanding.)

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as a character in the conversation. He is described as persisting with his question about the spell. (‘But it sounds like it was invented while you were at school,’ Harry persisted.)

entities.name: james
entities.description: James is mentioned as a character in the conversation. He is described as being a pure-blood and having never asked to be called 'Prince'. (He looked into Harry’s face and then said quietly , ‘James was a pure-blood, Harry , and I promise you, he never asked us to call him “Prince”.’)

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is mentioned as a character in the conversation. He is described as possibly being referred to by the nickname 'Prince'. (Abandoning pretence, Harry said, ‘And it wasn’t Sirius? Or you?’)

entities.name: spell
entities.description: The spell is mentioned in the conversation. It is described as being popular and having been invented while Lupin was at school. (‘But it sounds like it was invented while you were at school,’ Harry persisted.)

relationships.description: Lupin is related to the spell as he mentions that it may have been invented while he was at school. (‘But it sounds like it was invented while you were at school,’ Harry persisted.)
Harry questioned Lupin about the spell. (‘But it sounds like it was invented while you were at school,’ Harry persisted.)

James had a title of 'Prince' but never asked to be called that. (He looked into Harry’s face and then said quietly , ‘James was a pure-blood, Harry , and I promise you, he never asked us to call him “Prince”.’)
Harry suspected that Sirius may have been referred to by the nickname 'Prince'. (Abandoning pretence, Harry said, ‘And it wasn’t Sirius? Or you?’)
Harry suspected that Lupin may have been referred to by the nickname 'Prince'. (Abandoning pretence, Harry said, ‘And it wasn’t Sirius? Or you?’)
